title: In Situ Gas and Liquid Cell Imaging and Spectroscopy of Nanocatalysts
content: Improving the selectivity and durability of metal single atom and nanoparticle catalysts is essential to enable new catalytic transformation that support the transition to a net zero carbon energy landscape. Scanning transmission electron microscopy has a key role to play supporting our improved understanding of nanocatalyst synthesis and the materialâ€™s structural and chemical evolution during catalyst activation. Yet to fully characterize these complex systems requires atomic spatial resolution and spectroscopy to be performed in reactive environments.
